text:
Priscilla Presley is such a legendary beauty, but she underwent plastic surgery in the past that left her with some unfortunate side effects. Keep scrolling to find out what cosmetic procedures she’s had done over the years.

Has Priscilla Presley Undergone Plastic Surgery?

The mother of two has spoken out about the botched cosmetic procedures she’s had done in the past. Her spokesperson claimed that she unknowingly had industrial low-grade silicone — similar to what mechanics use to grease car parts — injected into her face by a doctor who wasn’t licensed to practice medicine in the U.S.

“Priscilla Presley was one of many documented victims of Dr. Daniel Serrano,” the actress’ rep shared in 2008. “An investigation which uncovered his misconduct ultimately led to his imprisonment. Ms. Presley dealt with this matter years ago and everything is now well.”

Serrano, who wasn’t licensed to practice medicine in the U.S., was deported to Argentina after serving 18 months in federal prison. Some of his injections caused lumps, paralysis and holes in his clients’ faces.

Sipa/Shutterstock

What Was Priscilla Presley’s Life Like With Elvis?

The former Dallas star met music icon Elvis Presley in 1959 during a party at his home in Germany when the legendary singer was serving overseas in the U.S. Army. Her stepfather was a member of the U.S. Air Force stationed there at the time. The two kept in touch and Priscilla eventually moved to Elvis’ home in Memphis, Tennessee, to be with him in 1963.

The pair wed on May 1, 1967, in a brief Las Vegas ceremony when she was 21 years old. The couple welcomed their only child, daughter Lisa Marie Presley, on February 1, 1968. Elvis and Priscilla were only married for four years, separating in 1972 and divorcing the following year.

Moviestore/Shutterstock

Priscilla would be the King of Rock and Roll’s only wife, as he tragically died on August 16, 1977, at the age of 42 after suffering a heart attack at his Memphis home, Graceland.

Over the years, Priscilla has helped keep Elvis’ memory alive with his fans. She led the celebration for what would have been the singer’s 75th birthday on January 8, 2010, with a large party at Graceland. Lisa Marie and her children, Riley and Benjamin Keough, were there to honor the grandfather they never met.

Priscilla and Lisa Marie were heavily involved in director Baz Lurhmann‘s 2022 biopic, Elvis, based on the singer’s life and his close connection to his manager, Col. Tom Parker. Both of the ladies were in the audience for the 2023 Golden Globe Awards to watch star Austin Butler win the award for Best Actor in a Motion Picture: Drama. Austin told Priscilla and Lisa in his acceptance speech, “Thank you for opening your hearts, your memories, your home to me,” adding, “Lisa Marie, Priscilla, I love you forever.”

Scroll down to see her transformation over the years.
